incidents.name: Build and Deployment Errors When Creating New Deployments

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Customers are currently unable to create new deployments through the Git integrations, CLI, or API. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this incident.

incidents.name: Elevated Dashboard and API Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating reports of elevated error rates on the Vercel Dashboard and API. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: DNS record updates are delayed for domains using Vercel Nameservers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

This incident has been resolved, and we continue to monitor our systems closely.

SSL certificates are still being processed for domains recently acquired through Vercel or that switched to Vercel's Nameservers recently.
This incident has been resolved, and we continue to monitor our systems closely.
The issue has been addressed in a few DNS regions. We are working to resolve this issue fully as soon as possible.
We are closely working with our partners to address this issue as soon as possible.
The issue has been identified, and a fix is being implemented.

Vercel is experiencing issues updating DNS records for new domains acquired through our platform, domains that recently switched to Vercel's Nameservers, and new DNS records added to domains that are already using Vercel's Nameservers.

incidents.name: Elevated 5xx errors and latency in gru1 (São Paulo, Brazil)

incident_updates.body:
We investigated elevated reports of 5xx errors and latency in the gru1 (São Paulo, Brazil) region between Sep 10, 3:45 AM – Sep 10, 3:48 AM UTC.

The issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Edge Config Service Degradation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been addressed, and deployments are no longer impacted. We are currently monitoring our systems.
We are currently investigating an issue with elevated errors rates in Edge Config.

incidents.name: User Registration Service Degradation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently experiencing elevated error rates that are affecting our user registration service. Users may encounter difficulties when attempting to sign up for new accounts. Some registration attempts may fail, while others may experience significantly longer processing times than usual.

Our engineering team is actively investigating this issue and working on a resolution. Existing user logins are not affected.

We recommend that users experiencing signup difficulties try again later.

incidents.name: Secure Compute builds failing to start

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating Secure Compute builds failing to start properly.

incidents.name: npm package installs failing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
npm is experiencing degraded performance. Affected users may experience timeout issues when installing packages, which may cause failed builds.

incidents.name: Deployment Creation Errors from GitLab commits

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating elevated error reports of deployment creation for commits from GitLab. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

Updates from GitLab are available here: https://status.gitlab.com/pages/incident/5b36dc6502d06804c08349f7/68a704148b984405a33ebd51

incidents.name: Intermittent deployment failures and elevated dashboard latency

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating reports of deployment failures and elevated latency in the Vercel dashboard due to an API issue. This issue does not affect production deployments or live traffic.

incidents.name: Elevated error rate for builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate the issue.
We are currently investigating elevated error rates affecting builds. Our engineering team has been notified and is working to identify the root cause.

incidents.name: Issues accessing Documentation, Guides, and Support Forms

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating reports of 404 errors when trying to access our documentation, guides, or the support form.

incidents.name: GitLab integration authentication and deployment issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. The issue originated from a disruption on GitLab’s side. For more information, please refer to their incident report: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/-/issues/20290
The errors with authenticating and deploying through GitLab have been reduced. We are continuing to monitor.
We're currently investigating the issue affecting GitLab authentication and deployment failures.

incidents.name: Elevated MODULE_NOT_FOUND Errors While Deploying

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating reports of MODULE_NOT_FOUND errors when creating new deployments.

incidents.name: Delay in issuing SSL certificates for new deployments.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Due to a delay in SSL certificate issuance, new deployments are not accessible over HTTPS. Production and preview traffic to existing deployments is not affected.

incidents.name: Increased 5xx errors in Vercel API, vercel.com, and v0.dev

incident_updates.body: We are no longer observing increased errors, and the incident should be resolved. Our team is still monitoring our health metrics closely.
The issue is resolved, and we are currently monitoring our systems.

We are currently investigating reports of errors in the Vercel dashboard, Vercel API, and the v0 dashboard.
Production and preview deployments are not affected by this issue.

incidents.name: Reports of queued builds

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved. We are still monitoring the status of our build's systems, and related services, closely.
The issue has been identified and resolved, and we're actively monitoring build infrastructure and dependent services.
We have identified the issue, and our engineers are working on a fix.
We are investigating reports of deployments in the "queued" state for new builds. Live traffic is not affected by this issue.

incidents.name: Degraded External API Calls and Edge Config usage

incident_updates.body:
The incident was resolved. During this window (11:14 - 15:16 UTC, depending on regions), some request data, like external API calls, was not recorded due to an internal logging disruption. As a result, requests made during this period will not appear in the dashboard, logs, or analytics APIs.

Application execution was not impacted. The issue only affected the recording of observability and billing data.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating reports of missing data for External API Calls chart under Observability tab and Edge Config under Usage and Billing tabs. End-user traffic is not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Pro usage within allocation is incorrectly being reported as an on-demand charge

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Pro usage within the allocation for regionally priced products is currently being displayed as an on-demand charge as part of our recent iteration on the Usage dashboard. This is a display issue only. You won’t be charged for usage within your allocation. We’re actively working to fix this.

incidents.name: Intermittent Issues Affecting Team Creation and Billing Details Access

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We’re investigating increased latency and errors when creating teams and viewing billing details.

incidents.name: GitHub deployments degraded

incident_updates.body: Between 22:58 and 23:33 UTC, an internal service degradation caused deployments triggered by GitHub to not be properly processed. Service has been fully restored, but impacted customers need to re-trigger deployments attempted during this interval.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Service Disruption: Billing, Team Management, and Plan Upgrades

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We're currently experiencing issues with an upstream provider affecting usage and invoice viewing, team creation, plan upgrades, product purchases, and access to the v0 plan. We're working to resolve this as quickly as possible.

incidents.name: npm package installs failing with 5xx errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

npm is experiencing degraded performance. Affected users may see 5XX errors when installing packages, which may cause failed builds. 

npm status page: https://status.npmjs.org/incidents/dn5mcp85737y

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard not accessible

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
At this time, Vercel Dashboard is inaccessible for all users. We have identified the root cause and are implementing a fix.

incidents.name: Incorrect Edge Functions data shown in Observability

incident_updates.body: From 19:27 to 20:40 UTC, the Observability tab showed wrong status codes and error rates for Edge Functions. We’re working on correcting this data, and the correction should be fully completed in the next 12 hours.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating intermittent issues when viewing deployments and projects on the Vercel Dashboard.

incidents.name: GitHub Deployment and API Errors

incident_updates.body: All systems normal.

We’re currently experiencing issues with services that rely on GitHub, including login and signup, Deployment, and linking projects.

This is due to an ongoing incident on GitHub's side, which is affecting API responses and OAuth functionality. You can follow the incident directly on GitHub’s status page: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/d0nm3xcdc5jw.

We’re monitoring the situation closely and will provide updates as GitHub rolls out a fix.

incidents.name: Errors loading dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Some users may experience errors loading the dashboard.

incidents.name: DNS Verification Issue

incident_updates.body: All domain verification functionality has been restored.
We have identified the cause of this incident and are working on a fix. Scope of impact is limited to domains that are in a configured DNS record set but not yet verified.

We are investigating errors in our DNS configuration UI. It is occasionally showing your existing DNS records instead of the records you should be setting.

You may still configure a domain manually:
- For apex domains, set an A record to 76.76.21.21
- For subdomains, set a CNAME record to cname.vercel-dns.com

incidents.name: Elevated errors while deploying

incident_updates.body: We have restored functionality to impacted services.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the issue and are working on a fix.
You may intermittently experience errors when creating new deployments. We are investigating and will provide updates as we work to resolve the incident.

We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: v0 degraded availability

incident_updates.body: Some users may have experienced issues accessing v0 from 17:04 UTC - 17:10 UTC. This issue has since been resolved.

incidents.name: v0 Deployment issues with Radix tabs

incident_updates.body: Some users may have experienced issues deploying from v0 if Radix tabs were used between 15:50 and 17:05 UTC. This issue is now fixed.

incidents.name: Intermittent Issues Serving Traffic Out of hnd1 (Tokyo, Japan) Region

incident_updates.body: Between 07:40 and 07:58 UTC, some users experienced increased latency and error rates for traffic served through the hnd1 (Tokyo, Japan) region. The issue has been resolved, and services are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Private npm package installs failing with 4xx errors

incident_updates.body: This issue is now resolved. nppmjs.org have marked the issue as resolved on their status page as of 15:00 UTC.
npm have released a status page incident, and users can monitor further updates here: https://status.npmjs.org

We have observed authentication issues to private registries using npm access tokens. Affected users may see 4xx errors when installing private packages. Manually regenerating tokens appears to resolve this issue. At this time, there is no official statement from npm or GitHub regarding the root cause.

incidents.name: Monthly performance emails sent in error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're investigating some monthly performance emails that were sent in error.

incidents.name: Elevated reports of projects being paused

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

A fix is being rolled out and most of the affected projects were unpaused.
We will continue to share updates as they become available.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating reports of elevated projects being paused despite the specified Spend Limit not being reached, resulting in incorrect notifications and paused deployments. This does not affect actual invoices.
We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Vercel Community unavailable

incident_updates.body: Access to the Vercel Community site has been restored. If you are still unable to reach the site, please try clearing your browser cache or opening in an Incognito/Private window.
The Vercel Community site is currently unavailable to some users. We are investigating and will provide further updates as the incident progresses.

We are currently investigating missing OTEL traces for Datadog exports since ~17:37 UTC. Other providers are unaffected.

We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently investigating an issue where the Vercel Integrations page is down. This affects the Integrations tab in the Vercel Dashboard. 

Integration connections with your projects are not affected and it is only the Vercel Dashboard that is unavailable. Integrations can also still be viewed from the Storage tab on the Vercel Dashboard.

incidents.name: Some Enhanced Build Machines are queued

incident_updates.body: The issue has now been fully resolved. From 12:15 UTC - 14:57 UTC, a portion of deployments on Enhanced Build Machines were delayed in a "Queued" state. No deployments were lost and all deployments are now building as expected.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Delayed runtime logs on bom1 and pdx1 regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Log delivery in all regions has returned to normal. We are continuing to monitor
pdx1 is no longer affected. We are still observing some delayed logs in bom1
We have confirmed that Log Drains were unaffected by this incident and continue to operate as normal.
We have identified a delay in log delivery specifically affecting bom1 and pdx1. We will continue to investigate and provide updates as this progresses.

incidents.name: Increase in INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body: During a 4-minute window today between 12:47-12:51 UTC, we experienced a brief increase in 500 errors affecting a small subset of Edge Functions invocations. The issue was isolated to the following regions: lhr1, bom1, hkg1, cdg1, hdn1, iad1. Edge Middleware and Serverless Functions were unaffected.

incidents.name: Ignore Build Step triggered erroneously on some builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Deployments created after this time (13:44 UTC) should no longer face the issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Some builds are erroneously being cancelled with the message:

The Deployment has been cancelled as a result of running the command defined in the "Ignored Build Step" setting.
